name: UITableView.RowAnimation
desc: The type of animation to use when inserting or deleting rows.

items.name: case fade
items.desc: The inserted or deleted row or rows fade into or out of the table view.

items.name: case right
items.desc: The inserted row or rows slide in from the right; the deleted row or rows slide out to the right.

items.name: case left
items.desc: The inserted row or rows slide in from the left; the deleted row or rows slide out to the left.

items.name: case top
items.desc: The inserted row or rows slide in from the top; the deleted row or rows slide out toward the top.

items.name: case bottom
items.desc: The inserted row or rows slide in from the bottom; the deleted row or rows slide out toward the bottom.

items.name: case none
items.desc: The inserted or deleted rows use the default animations.

items.name: case middle
items.desc: The table view attempts to keep the old and new cells centered in the space they did or will occupy. Available in iPhone 3.2.

items.name: case automatic
items.desc: The table view chooses an appropriate animation style for you. (Introduced in iOS 5.0.)
